summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 discussing the status of evidence processing in the Epstein case. It focuses on tracking and verifying digital evidence from multiple devices and servers, noting issues like blank files and physically failed drives requiring specialist recovery.

events.title: Evidence Status Update Email Chain
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the status of digital evidence processing from devices related to the Epstein case, including questions about spreadsheet accuracy and blank files.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated July 24, 2020, concerning the status of Epstein evidence processing.
A vendor reviewing seven initial devices reported approximately 71,000 documents that are zero bytes (empty files).
Two servers with multiple drives have physically failed and require specialist data recovery, which is noted as a potentially long process.
The correspondence includes tracking of specific device identifiers (e.g., NYC024328, NYC024367, NYC027910) and references a color-coded spreadsheet for evidence status.
All email addresses and names of the correspondents are redacted in the provided text.
